title: How to Enable Education Edition in Minecraft (Bedrock Edition)

steps.title: Create a new world.
steps.content: Create a new world. Once you've launched Minecraft and signed in, you'll be able to create a new world for others to join with the "Education Edition" toggle enabled. You can't toggle this in a world that's already created, so you have to create a new world.

steps.title: Select Creative in the "Default Game Mode" drop-down.
steps.content: Select Creative in the "Default Game Mode" drop-down. If you have this set to survival, you won't have the ability to toggle the education edition.

steps.title: Click the switch next to "Activate Cheats" to turn it on .
steps.content: Click the switch next to "Activate Cheats" to turn it on . A colored switch will indicate that it is enabled. If the switch is grey, you won't be able to toggle "Education Edition."

steps.title: Click the switch next to "Education Edition" to turn it on .
steps.content: Click the switch next to "Education Edition" to turn it on . A colored switch will indicate that it is enabled.

steps.title: Click Continue.
steps.content: Click Continue . Minecraft will warn you about turning on the Education Edition, but click Continue to enable the feature and continue. You can switch any more toggles here to personalize your world before continuing.

steps.title: Click Create.
steps.content: Click Create . This will create your world with Education Edition enabled. When you open your inventory screen, you'll see that you have additions for the Education Edition. [1] X Research source
